Lancaster, CA 14/3/2012 Will definitely be going back!
We were jonesing for Chinese buffet food, so we drove over to Sakura. We looked in the windows at the very unimpressive and dingy dining room, packed asshole to elbow. We'd stepped about three inches from the entrance, seeing the disgusting carpet and overall shabby appearance, when we did a quick turn around and dashed back to the car. No way in hell did we want to step foot in that hole, no matter how inciting the food smelled. So, we remembered that Asia Buffet was near the Target by the mall, so we headed over.
What a relief! Respectful patrons, a lovely welcoming foyer, a koi fish pond, and a host who immediately took us to a table. We'd already been won over. The waiter took our drink orders and we hit the lines. We liked what we saw...lots of fruits, cold shrimp, Chinese staples (fried rice, orange chicken, broccoli beef), as well as some more intriguing dishes (salt&pepper squid). The sushi selection was good, too. Since we were there for weekday lunch, I don't think they had the prime rib available.
After two trips to the food lines and one plate of dessert, we were ridiculously full. I couldn't get enough walnut shrimp and the hubs couldn't get enough honey chicken. The orange chicken was a little soft for our liking, but we're those white folk who love Panda Express orange chicken. ;) The desserts are nothing spectacular, just your run of the mill buffet assortment of cookies, cheesecake, mystery pastries, and a self-serve soft-serve machine.
We were definitely cool with our bill. $9.99/each for food, $1.89 for each of our sodas, so our grand total was right around $25. While we kind of wish we'd worn stretchy pants or at least had properly mentally prepared ourselves for the onslaught of food we were about to experience, we will surely be going back to Asia Buffet in the near future. That is, if we can ignore the call of the chicken tikka masala across the parking lot at Malhi's.

Review from Jerry O.
1 friend 10 reviews

Hawthorne, CA 29/5/2012 Asian food - love it. Especially Thai. I think I must have been Asian in a prior life. But I'm getting ahead of myself.
Recently, my wife (who shall remain nameless) and I had occasion to visit Palmdale Regional Medical Center. Not to worry, just a heart attack, nothing serious. It was a long, long time ago and I take much better care of myself now, sort of. And I reduced the stress in my life, somewhat, got rid of my ex (who shall remain nameless also). But I'm getting away from the subject.
Anyway, after completing our business at PRMC we decided we needed to eat before beginning the long trek home. After being told that we'd find a large selection of places to eat in the mall on 10th St West, we headed in that direction. And in our search I saw the words "Asia Buffet" and the place started calling to me. We had no choice but to go in.
My first reaction upon entering the establishment was - BIG. Directly in front of us was a small fountain and pond. Small yet large enough to hold a bunch of fish. Koi . . . big goldfish . . . I don't know. Don't know anything about fish except when it comes to eating. To the immediate left was a pretty good sized dining room. Nice sized booths, comfortable. To the immediate right was a pretty good sized dining area. Less plush, but still nice. And beyond that was another large room similar to the room to the left.
And beyond the fountain and pond lay an expanse of food. All kinds of food. Many, many selections. A sushi bar, salads, chicken dishes, beef dishes, shrimp dishes, deserts . . . lots and lots of selections. Unfortunately, I found the food not quite as good as the large number of selections to choose from. Or perhaps I just chose the wrong ones.
The best thing I had was the Spinach Stir Fry, excellent, I highly recommend it. Also very good were the Honey Chicken and the Hot Pepper Chicken. The Chicken-On-A-Stick was good as was the Orange Chicken. I would recommend trying these dishes.
There was a cold unidentified chicken salad that was so-so and the Vegetable Lo Mein was nothing to write home about. But they weren't what I'd call bad. I just didn't go back for second servings of them.
I really like Black Pepper Beef so I was disappointed with what I got. It was flavorful, but the meat was very chewy. Had the Broccoli Beef and while it was also flavorful, it was also very chewy. Maybe it was just a bad day for beef. There was a Cilantro Shrimp that had a great sauce, but the shrimp was tasteless. Didn't really care for the Garlic Green Beans, although my wife really liked them. I felt they were a little too al dente for my taste.
They also had a Shrimp Ceviche that was pretty good. I know that's not Asian, but then neither was the Prime Rib they had. I didn't try any of that after chewing on the other beef I had.
I should mention that the staff were friendly, courteous, and attentive without being overly so. They would periodically walk by, observing the table to see if we needed anything, showing themselves in case we wanted to gain their attention, and not once interrupting our conversation or asking me a question as soon as I put a forkful of food in my mouth.
Really torn between three and four stars for this one. Wish I could select three and a half. So I guess since this is a first visit I'll have to give them the benefit of the doubt.

Littlerock, CA 31/10/2011 Came here with sister for dinner. If you are in AV and you're looking for a decent all you can eat buffet place for asian food, I would say this is it. If this place was located in Los Angeles, I would have given it 3 stars, but it's hard to find decent (americanized) Asian food in AV so I'm giving it 4 stars. The place is clean and big and the staff is courteous.
There are choices of Chinese, Korean, Japanese food. Seafood including crab legs, oysters, shrimps, crawfish, etc are there. A soup station, salad bar and dessert section is there too; it includes soft serve, pudding, fruits, pastries, etc. For two people with two drinks, the total came out to be about $36 but I had a $5 off coupon so I paid $31 plus tip.
Overall, I think the food is decent. Don't be afraid to try a little bit of everything. It seemed like many just stuck to 1 or 2 stereotypical asian food choices but I think you will be pleasantly surprised from trying something new at the buffet. The point is it's all you can eat with many choices to choose from.
TIP: For those who are sensitive to msg/fried foods/processed foods -IF YOU ARE ALLERGIC or sensitive to msg or have eczema, I do not recommend coming here to eat as you will barely have any choices. My sister's eczema flares and gets incredibly itchy from eating msg containing foods. So we asked one of the workers bringing out the food whether they use MSG or not. Neither the worker nor anyone else working there was able to answer us. We are assuming Asia Buffet food contains msg because when we got home, she was so itchy that she had to take benedryl to finally fall asleep.

I saw a review that compared this to Hometown. Hometown is garbage. Trust me. I get discounts there, and I refuse to go, cause its crap.
This is the KING of buffets in the AV. I mean, that's not saying much, since King Buffet, Buffet King, and Hometown Buffet all suck. It's just about goddamn time a good one landed and remind me that yes, good buffets still exist, and they're not only in Vegas.

Silver Spring, MD 6/1/2011 After being out of town for a year, my parents took me to this place for dinner the first evening I was back. This location has seen several different Asian buffets over the years, and apparently this version of the buffet opened late 2010.
WOW.... just WOW.... The variety of food was spectacular and absolutely delicious. Not to mention that it's a buffet so that you can eat as much of it as you like. This place could be troublesome for people that lack self control, it's just that good.
There is a huge fresh seafood section including raw oysters, steamed shrimp, crawfish, crab legs, and mussels. The sushi bar was revamped and even includes my favorite: SASHIMI! The variety of sushi was impressive, incredibly fresh and high quality. Such a place is difficult to find in a desert town such as Palmdale.
This place also has the usual Asian buffet staples such as a fruit and pudding dessert section, soft serve ice cream machine, assorted pastries and cakes and traditional Chinese dishes. New offerings included prime rib and halibut! Very classy!
I was incredibly impressed with the level of quality and amount of variety that this buffet has. It's definitely the classiest buffet in Palmdale, and a bargain at about $15/adult.

Lancaster, CA 16/3/2011 Considering the choices here in the AV, this is going to be the buffet I go back to for LUNCH. It was $9.99 per person, $2 for a drink which they deliver and refill for you. Not a bad price at all, but dinner is $15.99 and I did ask what the difference was. At dinner they add crab legs, oysters, prime rib and a few other things. I would rather spend my money elsewhere for dinner, at $16 plus tax and the drink... If you are going to eat the prime rib and crab legs, it would be a steal; but since I would probably stick with the items I had on the lunch menu it just wouldn't be worth the extra bucks.
First off, I love good quality sushi which is fresh and cut for me when I order it, as sushi should be, so I did NOT try the nigiri or maki sushi. I am not a fan of all you can eat low quality fish or maki in general. If you are going to go for an all you can eat sushi place, it is just like the others and there was the normal selection of precut nigiri (maguro, tai, anago etc) and a large selection of maki so for the price (lunch or dinner) you can't beat it especially with all the other offerings.
So, with that said, I did like the large assortment of seafood, soup, entrees and salads. I was very glad to see a spinach salad, Caesar salad, kimchi and healthy dark green lettuces. I don't eat an iceburg salad, it is 90% water and a waste of my time nutritionally so this was a big plus for me. They had a large array of fruit as well, watermelon, pineapple, kiwi, papaya, cantaloupe, honeydew, strawberries - all fresh. They had about 6 different soups too so this alone beats out that all you can eat soup/salad place in town. You CAN eat a very healthy lunch here for $9.99!
I was really impressed with the BBQ pork, usually it is chewy but theirs is actually tender and tasty. Not so much the chicken on the stick, but hey they can't make everybody happy with every dish. On the whole, there was nothing I truly hated, and more things I liked. They had mussels both in the shell by the raw bar and with cheese over on the entree side. My brother loves mussels and said they were really good. They also had clams, peel and eat shrimp, and crawfish.
They had a lot of seafood dishes: 2 kinds of cooked fish, shrimp a few different ways and the aforementioned precut sushi and raw bar.
They had enough soup, salad, and non-seafood entrees to keep someone who doesn't enjoy seafood content.
I am a fan, and will be back.

San Antonio, TX 4/5/2011 Took a chance on this buffet place, Asian-themed buffets are a crapshoot: some are good, many are bad, and several are just downright ugly. This one falls into the good category. If seafood is your thing then you'll love this place. They have a very good sushi section. I would normally never eat sushi at a buffet place, but this is worth the exeption.They have a wonderful assortment of rolls, some nigri (including tuna) and even sashimi. As for he cooked seafood you can't go wrong there either. They had snow crab legs, shrimp, clams, mussels, oysters, even crawfish as well as octopus and squid. All of it is fresh and good quality, and the roatation is constant because the place is busy. Other standouts include the roast duck, expertly cooked with a wonderful crispy skin. The Chinese spare ribs are also good, as are the chicken skewers, The beef w/ broccoli is also another winner. The orange chicken wasn't anything to write home about but given all the other tasty bits to eat there you can skip it. They also have a rib roast. Personally I think they overcook it (I like my meat rare) but it's well seasoned and if you like your meat more done then I do then you'll like the roast.
